player: name: full name of the NBA player (e.g., LeBron James).
birth_date: birth date of the player; use format YYYY/%-m/%-d (e.g., 1984/2/30).
nationality: nationality of the player (e.g., USA, France).
age: age of the player (if death_date is given, compute as death_date - birth_date; otherwise, compute as 2025/1/1 - birth_date).
team: the current NBA team the player belongs to, or the last NBA team the player joined if not currently active (e.g., Los Angeles Lakers).
position: player's primary position on the team; choose one from ['Frontcourt', 'Backcourt'].
draft_pick: the pick number at which the player was selected in the NBA draft (e.g., 1).
draft_year: the year the player was selected in the NBA draft; use format YYYY (e.g., 2003).
college: the college the player attended, if applicable (e.g., Duke University).
nba_championships: number of NBA championships the player has won (e.g., 4).
mvp_awards: number of NBA MVP awards the player has won; use 0 if none (e.g., 2).
olympic_gold_medals: number of Olympic gold medals the player has won (e.g., 3).
fiba_world_cup: number of FIBA World Cup titles the player has won (e.g., 1).
manager: name: name is the full name of the team owner (e.g. Jeanie Buss).
age: age is the age of the team owner, a integer (e.g. 45).
nationality: nationality is the nationality of the team owner (e.g. American).
nba_team: NBA_team is the NBA team's name the owner own, (e.g. Los Angeles Lakers).
own_year: own_year is year the owner have this NBA team (e.g. 2010).
team: team_name: team_name is the full name of the team (e.g. Los Angeles Lakers).
founded_year: founded_year is the year of this team team founded (e.g. 1947).
location: location is the lastest city the team team located (e.g. Los Angeles).
ownership: ownership is the name of the team's owner (e.g. Jeanie Buss).
championships: championships is the number of this team getting championships (e.g. 5).
city: city_name: city_name is the name of the city (e.g. Boston)
state_name: state_name is the name of the state the city is located in (e.g. California).
population: population is the population of the city (e.g. 7000000).
area: area is the area of the city in square kilometers (e.g. 89.64).
gdp: gdp is the gross domestic product of the city in millions (e.g. 7.2).
